column4: Hi everyone. I recently installed a webcam with the ov51x-jpeg driver. How can I see what /dev the camera might be at?
video0, video1, video2, video24, video25, video32, video33
this is a mythtv system so I got a couple of tuners on here too
does  cat /proc/bus/usb/devices | grep -i video say anything useful?
hmm not sure >_< wish i could but im not sure where to go from here, sorry :(
when a device gets recognized, what happens?
i believe it sees if it matches a udev rule and then makes the /dev/ device for it
can I tell which of these /dev/video* is mapped to that camera?
not that  i know how, the best way would perhaps be to  open gstreamer-properties, go to video and input, then just go through the devices until you find which one gives the camera image
ok, i cycled through until I found the camera at /dev/video2
Now I need to find the built-in mic
camera should have its own Alsa device (hw cameraname or something)
how can i find the avail. alsa devices?
too many to go through at 1:30 am EST. :-)  I'll look through it tomorrow. Thanks!
